ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and you are resident in this city -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And you are free to live upon it, --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: – this city wherein you have been rendered violable–
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: in which you are now living
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: For you (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) are in this city.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And you are free in this city.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And you shall be made free from obligation in this city--
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and thou art a lodger in this land;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And thou art an indweller of this city -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and you are dwelling in this city --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And thou shalt be allowed in yonder city -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: as you reside in this town;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And thou art a freeman of this City;-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And you are free (from sin, to punish the enemies of Islam on the Day of the conquest) in this city (Makkah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and you are a lodger in this country.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And you are a resident of this land.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And you, [O Muhammad], are free of restriction in this city -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [90:2] and you, O Muhammad (s), have free disposal of, sanction for, this land, in that you will be given permission to fight in it — and indeed God fulfilled this promise to him on the day of the Conquest [of Mecca] (thus this is a parenthetical statement intervening between that by which the oath has been sworn and that which is a supplement thereto).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And thou art an indweller of this city) and it is also said that this means: Allah has made lawful for you in 755 this city that which he did not make lawful to anyone before or after you; and it is also said that this means: you are excused regarding that which you do in this city.
